intro: Vochysia pseudopumila, commonly known as the small-leaf velvet tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Chrysobalanaceae and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage. The plant typically grows in humid, lowland tropical forests and thrives in shaded environments. Its leaves are small, elliptical, and often have a leathery texture. Vochysia pseudopumila produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by edible, fleshy fruits.
